clinical_study.official_title: Reliability and Validity of the Turkish Feeding/Swallowing Impact Survey

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the reliability and validity of the Turkish Feeding/Swallowing Impact Survey among caregivers of pediatric patients with swallowing disorders.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the reliability and validity of the Turkish Feeding/Swallowing Impact Survey among caregivers of pediatric patients with swallowing disorders.The internal consistency, test-retest reliability, and criterion validity of T-EAT-10 will be investigated. The internal consistency will be assessed using Cronbach's alpha. Intraclass correlation coefficient (ICC) value with 95 % confidence intervals will be calculated for test-retest reliability. The criterion validity of the scale will be determined by assessing the correlation between the Turkish Feeding/Swallowing Impact Survey and Karaduman Chewing Performance Scale, Tongue Thrust Rating Scale, Pediatric version of the Eating Assessment Tool. The validity will also be determined by completion of the Turkish Feeding/Swallowing Impact Survey before and after swallowing rehabilitation of pediatric patients.

primary_outcome.description: This scale is used to determine the concerns of caregivers related to their children feeding/swallowing difficulties

secondary_outcome.description: This scale is used to determine chewing performance level of children
This scale is used to determine tongue thrust severity of children

secondary_outcome.measure: Pediatric version of the Eating Assessment Tool
secondary_outcome.description: This tool is used to determine initial dysphagia symptom severity of children

arm_group.description: Caregivers of pediatric patients with swallowing disorders will be recruited.
Pediatric patients with swallowing disorders will be recruited.

intervention.description: The Turkish Feeding/Swallowing Impact Survey will be completed by the caregivers

Chewing performance with Karaduman Chewing Performance Scale, tongue control with Tongue Thrust Rating Scale, dysphagia symptom severity with the Pediatric version of the Eating Assessment Tool will be evaluated. These assessments will be done before and after swallowing rehabilitation program.

study_pop.textblock: Caregivers of pediatric patients with swallowing disorders

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Having a child with swallowing disorders aged between 6 months-18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Having a child without swallowing disorders
- Having a child with swallowing disorders aged below 6 months
